intro: Crocus speciosus subsp. xantholaimos, commonly known as the yellow-throated crocus, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the eastern Mediterranean. It features striking, showy flowers with pale yellow petals and a prominent, bright yellow throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and blooms in early spring. Its bulbs are adapted to well-drained soils and prefer full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant, early-season flowers.
